org.jogger
Interface NotFoundHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultNotFoundHandler
public interface NotFoundHandler

Provides a mechanism in which users can handle the case in which a resource is not found (usually for rendering a custom 404 template).

To use a custom handler create a concrete implementation of this class and configure it using Jogger.setNotFoundHandler(NotFoundHandler). If no handler is configured the DefaultNotFoundHandler is used.

Author:
German Escobar

Method Summary
 void handle(Request request, Response response)
          Handles the not found request.
